tit.e: Meiji setsu (the birthday of Emperor Meiji)
tit.cmt: 明治節→Meiji setsu (Meiji Festival) で登録がありましたが下記出典によると明治天皇の誕生日ということですので明治節i→Meij setsu (the birthday of Emperor Meiji) とすべきかと思われます。[出典：http://kotobank.jp/word/%E6%98%8E%E6%B2%BB%E7%AF%80]
tit.e: Meiji setsu (the birthday of Emperor Meiji)
Meiji setsu (the birthday of Emperor Meiji)

sen.j: 明治節（めいじせつ）は、かつての祝祭日の中の四大節（紀元節、四方節、天長節、明治節）の一つ。
sen.e: Meiji setsu is one of four major holidays; Kigensetsu (the National Foundation Day, Shiho-setsu (New Year Day), Ten chou setsu (the birthday of the present emperor), Meiji setsu (the birthday of Emperor Meiji) among the former public holidays.
sen.cmt: 明治節→Meiji setsu (Meiji Festival)の登録例にならい、四大節→four major festivals と登録してしまいましたが上記の理由、および出典から 四大節→four major holidays とすべきかと思われます。ご検討ください。
sen.e: Meiji setsu is one of four major holidays; Kigensetsu (the National Foundation Day, Shiho-setsu (New Year's Day), Ten chou setsu (the birthday of the present emperor), Meiji setsu (the birthday of Emperor Meiji) among the former public holidays.

The Meiji-setsu is one of the four grand national holidays in the former public holiday system: the Kigen-setsu (the National Foundation Day), the Shiho-setsu (New Year's Day), the Tencho-setsu (the birthday of the present emperor), and the Meiji-setsu (the birthday of Emperor Meiji).

sen.j: 明治天皇の誕生日で、昭和2年(1927年)制定。
sen.e: The birthday of Emperor Meiji, established in 1927.
The birthday of Emperor Meiji, established in 1927.
It was originally Emperor Meiji's birthday and the day called Meiji-setsu was established in 1927.

sen.j: 明治天皇の在位中は天長節だった日付が、名君とされ近代日本の礎を築いた明治天皇の御聖徳を偲び「國民の與論・總意として」制定されたものである。
sen.e: The day used to be Ten chou setsu during Emperor Meiji's reign, after he passed away the day was established as Meiji setsu commemorating the attainment of Emperor Meiji who established the foundation of the modern Japan and was respected as a ruler of virtue; it reflected `the agreed opinion of people' when it was established.
sen.cmt: 「國民の與論・總意として」の真意がやや不明だったのですが reflecting `the agreed opinion of peple' と解釈しました。
sen.e: The day used to be Ten chou setsu during Emperor Meiji's reign, after he passed away the day was established as Meiji setsu commemorating the attainment of Emperor Meiji who established the foundation of modern Japan and was respected as a ruler of virtue; it reflected `the agreed opinion of people' when it was established.

This day used to be called Tencho-setsu during Emperor Meiji's reign, and the anniversary called Meiji-setsu was established according to public opinion and consensus in memory of Emperor Meiji, who was regarded as a great ruler who laid the foundations for modern Japan.
It was abolished in 1948.
It was abolished in 1948.

sen.j: 現在の「文化の日」はこの日であるが、昭和21年(1946年)の日本国憲法公布にちなんで制定された。
sen.e: Although the present `Culture Day' is the same day as Meiji setsu, the day was established in association with the promulgation of the Japanese Constitution in 1946
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Although the present `Culture Day' is the same day as Meiji setsu, the day was established in association with the promulgation of the Japanese Constitution in 1946
Although this day is called 'Culture Day' at present, it was in fact established to celebrate the promulgation of Constitution of Japan of 1946.

sen.j: 昭和23年に公布されたもので、明治節とは直接の関係はないとされる。
sen.e: It was issued in 1948 and it is said that it had no direct connection with Meiji setsu.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It was issued in 1948 and has no direct connection with Meiji setsu.
It was issued in 1948 and has no direct connection with Meiji setsu.

sen.j: ただし、昭和23年2月26日の国会での議事録には、祝祭日の改正の議論において明治節を通じて「明治時代を永久に思い出して行きたい」との趣旨の答弁がされている。
sen.e: However, according to the minute book of the diet, a statement of `We will forever remember Meiji' through Meiji setsu, in a discussion on the amendment of public holiday was recorded.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, according to the book of minutes of the diet, a statement of `We will forever remember Meiji' through Meiji setsu, in a discussion on the amendment of the public holiday was recorded.

However, according to the Diet Record of February 26, 1948, there was a statement that people should remember what the Meiji period was like forever through the Meiji-setsu, during a discussion about the national holiday system change.

sen.j: 制定にあたっては実際には関係がないとは言えないところではある。
sen.e: It is a little hard to say that there is no direct connection between these issues when `Culture Day' was established.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It is a little bit difficult to say that there is no direct connection between these issues and when `Culture Day' was established.
It is not necessarily true that there is no direct connection between the Meiji-setsu and the establishment of Culture Day.

sen.j: 天皇の誕生日を記念し、国民の祝祭日として定めたことはこれが初めてである。
sen.e: Meiji setsu is the first public holiday which was established to commemorate the birthday of an emperor.

sen.e: `Meiji setsu' (lyric: Yuan HORIZAWA, song writing: Syu SUGIE,) was specified as `the school songs of Public holiday' in 1928.

The song named 'Meiji-setsu' (lyrics by Shuan HORIZAWA, music by Shu SUGIE) was designated as one of the school songs for public holidays in 1928.
